para_sentences.para_0: At this point, you should be able to answer all of the following questions.
para_sentences.para_1: You should now be able to write programs that interact with a user and carry out simple arithmetic processing. You should understand what types are, and how to cast from one type to another. You should also know how to comment your code to make it easier to understand.
para_sentences.para_2: If you are unsure of any of these answers, take some time to review the course materials. Feel free to post questions in Piazza or Teams. Next week's lessons will be easier if you have invested in mastering this week's learning outcomes.
para_sentences.para_3: Check the Explorations and Task List in the Lesson 2 - Overview to review learning materials and make sure you have completed all required activities for this week.

ul_0: How do you print out values?
What are types? How can you see the type of a value?
How do you assign a value to a variable?
How do you write a comment?
How do you do arithmetic? How can you concatenate strings?
How can you read input from the user?
How do you cast a value to a different type?
